intro: Hieracium chaubardianum, commonly known as Chaubard's hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and disturbed soils, preferring full sun. It produces small, yellow to orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a rough, hairy texture.
